docs.title: Datplot Overview
docs.text: DatPlot is a program that helps users view and analyze data. By uploading your data files, you can generate interactive line graphs and histograms. The program also allows you to adjust axis points, making it easy to focus on different variables in the dataset

docs.title: About
docs.text: DatPlot was created to help view driving simulation data at The Ohio State University Driving Simulation Laboratory. The program was created by research assistants to help aid data analysis efforts.

docs.title: Swap Axes
docs.text:
To help with analyzing different data points the two y axes can be swapped.

To swap the axis click the arrow button, this will swap the current y1 and y2 values.

docs.title: Drag and Drop
docs.text:
Another way to load data files into the program is the drag and drop feature

To use the feature, select the settings icon,

Then drag and drop a dat file into the drop area and it will load the new graphs

*Note when using the drag and drop feature, the uploaded file will not be added to the recent files dropdown

docs.title: Changing Save File Location
docs.text: To pick a specific location to save the plot to on your computer,

docs.title: 3. Pick the desired file location
docs.text: To view the current save location, under the save arrow the path can be seen.

docs.title: Changing Saved File Type
docs.text: To change the save file type, select the save button dropdown. Then select the dropdown on the far right to pick between, PNG, JPEG, or SVG.

docs.title: Viewing Recent Files
docs.text:
To view recent files select the arrow next to the file button.

Once pressed, the 5 most recent files will be seen.

docs.title: Zooming
docs.text: There are two different ways to zoom in the graph, using the slide zoom below the graph and the box zoom option in the options tab.

docs.title: Slide Zoom
docs.text:
To zoom in on the graph using the slide zoom, either highlight the graph or move the ends of the slider to specific points.

Highlighting

Sliding

docs.title: Box Zoom
docs.text: To use the box zoom, the toggle needs to be selected following the steps below,

docs.title: 2. Select the box zoom toggle button
docs.text:
The button will turn blue if the box zoom toggle is on.

To use the box zoom, highlight the area of the map that you want to zoom in on as seen below.

To stop using the box toggle go to settings and click the box zoom button so it turns gray.

docs.title: Opening a Dat File
docs.text: Once the program is open and running, to open a dat file:

docs.title: 2.Select the dat file in your file directory
docs.text: Once opened the graph should update with the data

docs.title: Viewing a Dat File
docs.text: Once a dat file is opened there are two ways to view the data, a line graph and a histogram

docs.title: Line Graph
docs.text: The line chart tab will already be selected

docs.title: Histogram
docs.text: To view the data as histogram, select the histogram tab

docs.title: Analyzing Data
docs.text: Once a dat file is loaded, the data can be analyzed by changing the X and Y axes

docs.title: 1. Pick an X axis
docs.text: Start by clicking on the X axis drop down and select a dataset

docs.title: 2. Pick a Y Axis
docs.text: Once, an X axis is chosen the next step is to select a Y axis dataset from the Y axis dropdown

docs.title: 3. View Plot
docs.text:
Once the X and Y axes are chosen, the full plot can be viewed as seen below.

In the image, the X axis chosen was SimTime, and the Y axis chosen was Gaze Heading. This can also be seen in the title of the graph and along their respected axes.

docs.title: Second Y Axis
docs.text:
An option to add a second dataset along the Y axis is available. To add another Y dataset select the second Y axis option and pick a data set as seen in the image below.

Once the data set is chosen a second line a different color will be displayed. The new Y Axis can be seen on the right of the graph.

docs.title: Viewing Summary Stats
docs.text: To see the summary statictics of the data, scroll under the graph to view

docs.title: Saving a Graph
docs.text: The dat file graphs are able to be saved as images, for more details on changing the save file type and changing the saved file location, see Saving Options

docs.title: Saving the Line Graph
docs.text: To save the line graph make sure the chart tab is selected and select the save icon

docs.title: Saving the Histogram
docs.text: To save the histogram graph make sure the histogram tab is selected and select the save icon

docs.title: Downloading the Program
docs.text: To get the program installed on a computer, download the datplot executable

docs.title: Starting up the Program
docs.text:
Once the datplot executable is downloaded, to start the program double click to open the excutable.

This will open the program and it will be ready to use.
